description: A Product or a Service that is bought, sold or kept in stock.

fields.description: If this item has variants, then it cannot be selected in sales orders etc.
fields.label: Has Variants

fields.options:

fields.description: Will also apply for variants unless overrridden
fields.label: Reorder level based on Warehouse

fields.description: Will also apply for variants
fields.label: UOMs

fields.description: Example: ABCD.#####. If series is set and Batch No is not mentioned in transactions, then automatic batch number will be created based on this series. If you always want to explicitly mention Batch No for this item, leave this blank. Note: this setting will take priority over the Naming Series Prefix in Stock Settings.
fields.label: Batch Number Series

fields.description: Maximum sample quantity that can be retained
fields.label: Max Sample Quantity

fields.description:
Example: ABCD.#####
If series is set and Serial No is not mentioned in transactions, then automatic serial number will be created based on this series. If you always want to explicitly mention Serial Nos for this item. leave this blank.
fields.label: Serial Number Series

fields.description: If item is a variant of another item then description, image, pricing, taxes etc will be set from the template unless explicitly specified
fields.label: Variant Of

fields.description: Minimum quantity should be as per Stock UOM
fields.label: Minimum Order Qty

fields.description: Average time taken by the supplier to deliver
fields.label: Lead Time in days

fields.description: Will also apply for variants
fields.label: Taxes

fields.description: If subcontracted to a vendor
fields.label: Supply Raw Materials for Purchase

fields.description: These values will be automatically updated in transactions and also will be useful to restrict permissions for this user on transactions containing these values.
fields.label: Defaults

fields.description: Enter default value fields (keys) and values. If you add multiple values for a field, the first one will be picked. These defaults are also used to set "match" permission rules. To see list of fields, go to "Customize Form".
fields.label: User Defaults

fields.description: Restrict user from this IP address only. Multiple IP addresses can be added by separating with commas. Also accepts partial IP addresses like (111.111.111)
fields.label: Restrict IP

fields.description: Allow user to login only after this hour (0-24)
fields.label: Login After

fields.description: If the user has any role checked, then the user becomes a "System User". "System User" has access to the desktop
fields.label: User Type

fields.description: Allow user to login only before this hour (0-24)
fields.label: Login Before

fields.description: If enabled,  user can login from any IP Address using Two Factor Auth, this can also be set for all users in System Settings
fields.label: Bypass Restricted IP Address Check If Two Factor Auth Enabled

fields.description: Stores the JSON of last known versions of various installed apps. It is used to show release notes.
fields.label: Last Known Versions

fields.description: API Key cannot be regenerated
fields.label: API Key

name: User
